column1: #Text=A series of polycrystalline NaAlP2O7:xPr3+ (x = 1, 3, 5, 7, 9, 11, 13%) powders were synthesized via a conventional high temperature solid-state reaction method.
#Text=All chemical reagents were purchased as starting materials without further purification.
#Text=Stoichiometric amounts of analytical reagents Na2CO3, Al2O3, NH4H2PO4 and 99.99% pure praseodymium oxide (Pr2O3) was mixed and pulverized.
#Text=First, the homogenous mixtures were preheated at 473 K for 4 h in order to decompose NH4H2PO4.
#Text=Subsequently, these mixtures were again ground and calcined in air at 1123 K for 6 days.
#Text=Next, the products were gradually cooled down to room temperature by switching off the muffle furnace and ground into powders for further characterization.
